body.directions: Listen to the audio; then, complete the multiple-choice questions that follow.

body.textVersion: Audio for 需要 xūyào (to need)

body.quiz: Which of the following sentences can be reasonably completed with the word in the audio?
body.answer: 我上英文课_____笔记本。Wǒ shàng yīngwénkè _____ bǐjìběn.
options: 我爸爸和妈妈都很_____。Wǒ bàba hé māma dōu hěn _____.
我爷爷总是在秋天_____生日。Wǒ yéye zǒngshì zài qiūtiān _____ shēngrì.
我今天上午八点_____学校。Wǒ jīntiān shàngwǔ bādiǎn _____ xuéxiào.
body.correct: Wonderfully done! 需要 xūyào means “to need,” and it can be best used to form the sentence “ 我上英文课需要笔记本 Wǒ shàng yīngwénkè xūyào bǐjìběn. (I need a notebook for English class.)”
body.incorrect: Very close. Think about the meaning of the word in the audio, and then place it in the sentences in the choices to see which one fits the best with an appropriate meaning.

body.quiz: Which of the following items can you most likely find in the item indicated in the audio?
body.correct: You got it! 背包 bèibāo means “backpack,” and the most appropriate items to fit in it would be notebooks and books.
body.incorrect: Not quite… listen to the word again and think about its meaning. Then identify the meanings of the items in the choices to see which ones can best fit.

body.quiz: Where of the following places are you least likely to find the item indicated in the audio?
body.answer: On the stove in a kitchen
options: On a desk in a classroom
On a shelf in the library
At a seat in a coffee shop
body.correct: Outstanding job! 书 shū means “book,” and the last place you’d expect it to be is on a kitchen stove.
body.incorrect: Oops… listen to the word again and think about its meaning. Then consider which place described would you least expect the item.

body.quiz: Which of the following people can often be seen with the one indicated in the audio?
body.answer: Audio for 老师 lǎoshī (teacher)
options: Audio for 女儿 nüér (daughter)
Audio for 服务员 fúwùyuán (waiter/waitress)
Audio for 医生 yīshēng (doctor)
body.correct: Terrifically done! 学生 xuésheng means “student.” We would most likely expect 老师 lǎoshī (teacher) to be with a student.
body.incorrect: Very close. Listen to the audio several times to understand its meaning; then review the audios in the choices to identify the one profession you would most likely expect to match.
